item.title: A t|ket> Implementation of Shor's Algorithm
item.description: I presented the project our team took on for the Qalypso 2022 Summer School on Quantum Computation Hackathon.

item.title: An Introduction to Combinatory Logic
item.description: Alexander Farrugia and I decided to collaborate for the second Summer of Math Exposition organised by Grant Sanderson!

item.title: Rubik's Cubes with a sprinkle of combinatorics and group theory.
item.description: A short talk given during a 'Quick fire Talk' organized by the Malta Mathematical Society.

item.title: Senza nome
item.description: A poem written around the beginning of 2022. First writing in Italian, first poem read to public, at the Lords private signing event on the 28th of March.

item.title: kvant
item.description: We all know that quantum computing is the future, so in order to practice my quantum computing skills, I have built my own encoding scheme, then I used it to hide the flag, can you recover it! kvant.py enc.txt This challenge was in the misc category of the first GDG Algiers CTF due to involving quantum computing. In my opinion, a well founded knowledge of cryptography is useful in this challenge as shown later.

item.title: My PGP Key
item.description: Here is my PGP public key. You can use it to verify any digitally signed files by me, or to communicate with me privately and securely. My email address is giorgio (at) grigolo (dot) mt Click the text to copy it. -----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK----- How to send PGP encrypted emails Most decent email clients (mutt, Thunderbird, Evolution, etc.) support PGP keys out of the box, you’ll just need to add a key in your account settings.
